attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: Returns the number of decimals the asset uses.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: The standardized decimals for NFTs is 0u8.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * `asset`: [AssetId] - The asset of which to query the decimals.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: Returns the name of the asset, such as “Ether”.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * `asset`: [AssetId] - The asset of which to query the name.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: Returns the symbol of the asset, such as “ETH”.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * `asset`: [AssetId] - The asset of which to query the symbol.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: Returns the total number of individual NFTs for this contract.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * [u64] - The number of assets that this contract has minted.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: Returns the total supply of coins for an asset.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: This must always be at most 1 for NFTs.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * `asset`: [AssetId] - The asset of which to query the total supply.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * [Option<u64>] - The total supply of coins for `asset`.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: Burns assets sent with the given `sub_id`.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: NOTE: The sha-256 hash of `(ContractId, SubId)` must match the `AssetId` where `ContractId` is the id of

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: the implementing contract and `SubId` is the given `sub_id` argument.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * `sub_id`: [SubId] - The sub-identifier of the asset to burn.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * `amount`: [u64] - The quantity of coins to burn.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: Mints new assets using the `sub_id` sub-identifier.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: This conforms to the SRC-20 NFT portion of the standard for a maximum

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: mint amount of 1 coin per asset.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * `recipient`: [Identity] - The user to which the newly minted assets are transferred to.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * `sub_id`: [SubId] - The sub-identifier of the newly minted asset.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * `amount`: [u64] - The quantity of coins to mint.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * When amount is greater than one.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * When the asset has already been minted.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * When more than the MAX_SUPPLY NFTs have been minted.

attributes.name: doc-comment

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * `asset`: [AssetId] - The asset of which to query the metadata.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * `key`: [String] - The key to the specific metadata.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * [Option<Metadata>] - `Some` metadata that corresponds to the `key` or `None`.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: * [State] - Represents the state of ownership for this contract.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: This function should never be called.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: NFT decimals are always `0u8` and thus must not be set.

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: This function is an artifact of the SetAssetAttributes ABI definition,

attributes.name: doc-comment
arguments: but does not have a use in this contract as the decimal value is hardcoded.
